item.title: [NTCIND] NTC Industries Ltd. Amends MOA, Aligning with Companies Act, 2013
item.description:
NTC Industries Ltd. has amended its Memorandum of Association (MOA) to align with the provisions of the Companies Act, 2013. The amendments include restructuring and altering the MOA, updating the title, and adding a new sub-clause to the main object. The new sub-clause involves carrying on the business of manufacturers, processors, producers, refiners, formulators, packers, re-packers, graders, blenders, wholesalers, distributors, stockists, traders, exporters, importers, buyers, sellers, and dealers of various food products and allied activities. The Registrar of Companies (ROC), Kolkata has approved the amended MOA on 18th February 2026.

  • NTC Industries Ltd. has amended its Memorandum of Association (MOA) to align with the Companies Act, 2013.
  • The amendments include restructuring and altering the MOA, updating the title, and adding a new sub-clause to the main object.
  • The new sub-clause involves carrying on the business of various food products and allied activities.
  • The Registrar of Companies (ROC), Kolkata has approved the amended MOA on 18th February 2026.
  • The amended MOA is now in compliance with the Section 13(1) of the Companies Act, 2013.

item.title: [RAYMOND] Raymond Ltd Proposes Appointment of Mr. Jatin Khanna as Non-Executive Non-Independent Director
item.description:

item.title: [SANOFI] Sanofi India Faces INR 2,37,02,854 Tax Demand for FY 2021-22 by Tamilnadu Commercial Tax Officer
item.description:
Sanofi India Ltd has received an order from the Office of the Commercial Tax Officer, Tiruvallur, Tamilnadu, dismissing the company's submissions and determining a total tax demand of INR 2,37,02,854 for FY 2021-22. This demand includes tax of INR 1,34,27,399, interest of INR 89,32,714, and penalty of INR 13,42,741. The Commercial Tax Officer did not consider the company's submissions and reconciliations regarding the eligibility of Input Tax Credit (ITC) pertaining to FY 2020-21, which was claimed in FY 2021-22. The company plans to make an appeal before Appellate Authorities.

  • Sanofi India Ltd faces a total tax demand of INR 2,37,02,854 for FY 2021-22
  • The demand includes tax, interest, and penalty amounts
  • The company's submissions and reconciliations regarding ITC eligibility were not considered
  • The order was issued by the Office of the Commercial Tax Officer, Tiruvallur, Tamilnadu
  • Sanofi India plans to appeal before Appellate Authorities

item.title: [ANURAS] Anupam Rasayan India Executes USD 30 Million ECB Facility Agreement with Axis Bank for Proposed Acquisition
item.description:
ðŸ”¥ Trending

Anupam Rasayan India Limited has executed a facility agreement on 14 February 2026 for a credit facility of USD 30,000,000 (United States Dollars Thirty Million) to be availed as External Commercial Borrowing (ECB) from Axis Bank Limited, IBU GIFT City and other syndicated lenders. The ECB Facility shall be secured by the Company by way of hypothecation and mortgage documents. The proceeds of the ECB Facility will be utilized for partially funding the acquisition of the entire shareholding of Monitchem Kansas S.a r.l., and associated costs. The agreement was inadvertently registered as executed on 12 February 2026, which should have read as 14 February 2026.

  • Execution of a facility agreement for a credit facility of USD 30,000,000 as External Commercial Borrowing (ECB) from Axis Bank Limited, IBU GIFT City and other syndicated lenders.
